statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content: The Euler function phi is an important kind of function in number theory,  (n) represents the amount of the numbers which are smaller than n and coprime to n, and this function has a lot of beautiful characteristics. Here comes a very easy question: suppose you are given a, b, try to calculate  (a)+ (a+1)+....+ (b)

statement.title: Input
statement.content: There are several test cases. Each line has two integers a, b (2<a<b<3000000).

statement.title: Source
statement.content: 2009 Multi-University Training Contest 1 - Host by TJU
